sense.gloss: lightly rolling (of a small and round thing)
pleasant, high-pitched sound (e.g. bell, young woman's laughter)
changing frequently (e.g. conversation, plans), (occurring) in rapid succession (e.g. sumo wrestlers being defeated), fickly, in a fickle manner
ribbit ribbit (sound of frogs), croak croak

sdata.j: ↑毎週↑↓まいしゅう↓↑火曜日↑↓かようび↓には、↑先生↑↓せんせい↓の|ころころ|した↑小↑↓ちい↓さな↑指↑↓ゆび↓がピアノの↑鍵盤↑↓けんばん↓をあちこちと↑鳥↑↓とり↓のように↑飛↑↓と↓びはねていました。
sdata.e: Every Tuesday her fat little fingers flew like birds up and down the keys of song too.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑足元↑↓あしもと↓に↑野球↑↓やきゅう↓のボールが|ころころ|と↑転↑↓ころ↓がってきた。
sdata.e: A baseball came rolling to my feet.
